thread.title: Falcons-Saints by the numbers

author: left_col_positional_height){$(rel).addClass('cm-outset-left');}});}});})(cmg.query);}());
title: Falcons-Saints by the numbers
text:
702
Points scored by Falcons kicker Matt Bryant in his career, surpassing 700 with three point-after conversions in the 31-21 loss to the Saints. He joins Morten Andersen as the only Falcons player to reach 700.
312
New Orleans Saints tight end Benjamin Watson, of UGA, makes a touchdown catch against the Atlanta Falcons during the second half of an NFL football game, Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, in New Orleans. (AP Photo/Gerald Herbert) Passing yards allowed by the Falcons to the Saints’ Drew Brees.
295
Passing yards by the Falcons’ Matt Ryan.
Photos: Saints hand Falcons first loss of season 127
Career-high reception yardage by Saints’ Ben Watson, a tight end from Georgia.
100
Rushing yards by the Falcons’ Devonta Freeman, including a 25-yard scoring run. Freeman has 462 yards rushing through six games, best in the NFL.
9
Touchdowns scored by Freeman, including two on Thursday, with the run and a late 13-yard pass reception.
4-2
Matt Ryan’s record in Thursday games.
19-2
Saints’ record in NFL prime-time games in the Superdome.
265
Falcons’ yardage in the first half. They had been averaging 406 yards per game and gained 413.
3
Falcons’ fumbles recovered by the Saints, including two inside the New Orleans 20.
